""
"Semantic Clustering: It automatically finds similar images and clusters them by meaningful themes—like a human curator."

""

""
"🧠 Technical Insight (for my tech-minded network):"
""

""
"Yet the true magic isn't just in the code, it's in the new workflows and creative opportunities it unlocks."
""
"Reflecting on this journey makes me wonder:"

We flipped nanotech from bottom-up to top-down.  "
"Software is next."
""
"One year ago, I asked a simple yet ambitious question:  "
"Can I create an app that turns my images into a vector database and helps me organize my library?"
""
"Not just searching by meaning, but clustering and tagging my images automatically..."
""
"Pixel Detective was born.  "
"A prompt-driven, AI-fueled experiment powered by vector databases, curiosity, and (admittedly) chaos."
""
"The first prototype? Painfully rough.  "
"Early prompts? Awkward at best.  "
"The backend? One GPU overload from total disaster."
""
"But science trained me for this:  "
"Formulate hypotheses. Test rigorously. Fail gracefully.  "
"Repeat until breakthrough."
""
"My key discovery was in how to effectively plan a software, improve and debug it, when you don't fully understand what is written in your codebase."
""
"This isn't software engineering, it's a shift:  "
"- From bottom-up (Planning, syntax, specs)  "
"- To top-down (intent, language, interaction)."
""
"I think of this project as a Prompt-to-Program Manifesto."
"It’s already transforming my AI workflows and productivity, and soon, it may transform yours."
""
"⚠️ Be warned: this app demands power (and maybe patience).  "
"You’ll need a solid GPU—and possibly a stiff drink.  "
"But if you're ready for the future: clone it, break it, rebuild it better."
""
"🚀 Tech Stack Spotlight – Pixel Detective"
""
"   🖥 Frontend: NextJs 15 + TypeScript"
"   🎨 Chakra UI v3 + Zustand + React Query"
"   📦 API-driven design, modular components"
""
"  🧠 Backend:"
" "
"FastAPI microservices:"
"     🔁 Ingestion Orchestration"
"     🧠 ML Inference (CLIP, BLIP) – CUDA-optimized"
"     📉 GPU UMAP Clustering – cuML-powered"
"     📡 All talking via REST APIs, containerized with Docker, Inc."
"     📚 Database: Qdrant – blazing fast vector DB with hybrid search &      metadata filtering"
"     💡 From image ingestion to semantic search to UMAP-powered 2D projections – everything flows in real time."
""
""
"💬 If your words could become working code instantly, what's the first thing you’d build?"
""
"Share your idea, or projects, I'd love to connect!  "
""
" #GenAI #PromptEngineering #AIworkflow #DigitalTransformation #VectorDB #SyntheticBiology

""
"I’ve been building Pixel Detective to combine state-of-the-art image captioning with vector + keyword search.  "
"It was going well... until hybrid search started returning inconsistent results."
""
"The culprit? "
""
"The sci Fi ideas I get when I talk with LLMs... and the spare time I have"
""
"So I tried something new:  "
"I asked Claude 4."
""
"Using a prompting framework I’d been refining for GenAI coding flows, I laid out the symptoms, point to files."
""
"Claude didn’t just suggest changes—it explained *why* the hybrid scoring was too restrictive for my library"
""
"It implemented the fix. It worked. Fast."
""
"This wasn’t just a bug fix— it's a new path forward."
""
"---"
""

"Have you used Claude 4 (or another GenAI) for real debugging yet?"
""
"Share your biggest GenAI dev moment—or a time it completely misfired. "

I never really learned to code. But I always had ideas."
""
"I’ve always felt that gap. I’m a scientist. A builder. A systems thinker.  "
"But code? That was the one skill I never had time to fully master."
""
"Then GenAI came along—and for the first time, I saw a bridge."
""
"I created Codyssey, my first coding assistant.  "
"A translator between my “monkey language” and executable Python.  "
"For simple scripts, it was magic.  "
"For anything more complex… it was chaos."
""
"AI-generated code breaks fast.  "
"It’s messy. Undocumented. And the deeper your project gets, the worse it becomes.  "
"No structure. No clarity. Console errors I couldn’t even interpret.  "
"The dream started slipping."
""
"So I built something new."
""
"Meet Calatrava, The Forgekeeper."
""
"An system born from necessity.  "
"A custom GPT to work alongside Cursor IDE to bring clarity, structure, and vibe to AI development."
""
"Many call it vibe coding.  "
"Because it’s not about syntax—it’s about flow.  "
"It’s about tracking your ideas as they evolve.  "
"Debugging without dread. Building without fear."
""
"Calatrava helps you:"
""
"- Maintain modular structure across files and folders  "
"- Autogenerate GitHub commits and documentation  (through MCP)"
"- Avoid common AI pitfalls with embedded guardrails  (Ask for the doc)"
"- Explain why a solution was chosen (not just spit it out)  "
"- Get to working MVPs—without pretending it's production-ready magic"
""
"It’s not perfect. It’s not clean code for production.  "
""
"But it’s enough to make your vision real."
""
"Especially if you, like me, never felt fluent in code—but always had something to build."
""
"Why it matters."
""
"I built Calatrava to finish my Hugging Face agent certification.  "
"I stayed for what it unlocked:"
""
"- The power to debug without crying  (Too hard)"
"- The ability to track my experiments  (Works like a charm)"
"- The freedom to create, not just copy-paste  (See previous posts)"
"- The joy of feeling like I can build real things—finally"
""
"This isn’t a product launch.  "
"This is a small invitation."
""
"If you’ve ever felt locked out of AI development—this is for you.  "
"If you’re a scientist, a creative, a rebel, or a builder with unfinished ideas—this is for you."
""
"Calatrava won’t make you a dev overnight, over a week or over months... "
"  "
"But he will help you hold the hammer and point to you where to hit"
""
"The GPT?  "
"Find it in the comments.  "
"That’s where the fire starts."
""
"#VibeCoding #AItools #GPTs #CalatravaTheForgekeeper #NoCodeBuilders #AgenticSystems #LinkedInCreators #HuggingFace #CursorIDE #OpenSourceAI"

Coding with AI is magical, until it isn't... "
""
"If you know me, you know I do photography. And like a lot of photographers, I’ve got way too many pictures and not nearly enough tags to organize them.  "
""
"This means that... finding the right shot = A nightmare.  "
""
"At some point, I figured it was worth trying to fix my situation with AI. Not as some polished product, not to sell. Just something to make my life easier.  "
""
"So I asked ChatGPT, can I build something to help me retrieve my own pictures?  "
""
"Turns out, yeah. I could. And that moment was kind of incredible. A random idea in my head became an actual locally working app.  "
""
"But here’s what surprised me. The hardest part wasn’t the coding (which I'm not technically doing). It was realizing it was even possible in the first place. It was learning how to ask the right questions and refine my idea until AI actually gave me something useful.  "
""
"Some call this vibe coding. Less about typing code, more about shaping a conversation with AI until something clicks. And in the end, AI didn’t just help me build. It helped me think differently.  "
""
"Now I’m taking this further, working on a tool to analyze videos automatically as part of a bigger home AI project. But that’s a story for another time.  "
""
"This latest experience taught me something important. Without knowing how to code, you can quickly get things working. Building an MVP is easy. But getting it to production? That still requires real software engineering skills.  "
""
"Those, you need to build for yourself. But in the meantime, if you want to refine your own AI-driven projects, I can hook you up with my v0 instructions for Cursor (see the commentsor or my Github).  "
""
"Now I pass the keyboard to you. Have you ever tried coding with AI? What was the first thing you built?  "
""
"#AI #Coding #Automation #GenAI #AIWorkflows #TechExperiments  "
"

A year ago, I would have never imagined building an app from scratch. Not because I didn’t want to—but because I didn’t have the skills. "
""
"Then came AI-assisted coding. 🚀  "
""
"I had a real issue: managing my personal database, specifically how I look at my pictures in a structured way. Instead of hiring a developer or spending months learning to code, I decided to see how far AI could take me.  "
""
"🤖 ChatGPT helped me get started. It allowed me to recreate scripts I had worked on in my research, but the quality was still shaky. Then, the new reasoning models improved—and suddenly, the process felt *different.* Last week, I built and shared an app in record time. It wasn’t perfect, but it worked.  "
""
"⚡ Then I discovered **Cursor**—an IDE that lets you *speak* your thoughts and translates them into code. Now, I wasn’t just tweaking AI-generated scripts. I was *driving* the development process at a high level, like an architect working with a hyper-intelligent assistant.  "
""
"💡 So, here’s my question: If AI-assisted development can help a non-coder like me build functional products, how far can this scale?"
"Could we see AI-generated code powering real market-ready apps? Not as a replacement for engineers—but as a force multiplier for innovation?  "
""
"Have you experimented with AI-assisted coding? Could you see it leading to real digital products hitting the market? Let’s talk. 👇  "
""
"In the comments, I’ll share my first and second repositories so you can see the difference in quality. I’d love to hear your thoughts—publicly or privately.  "
""
"#AI #GenerativeAI #Coding #NoCode #AIInnovation #DigitalTransformation #PromptEngineering #SoftwareDevelopment #Innovation

When people start using AI, they do what feels natural."
""
"They ask it questions like they would Google."
"They type queries like a search engine."
"They try, get a poor answer, and often quit."
""
"But some keep going. They start tweaking their inputs, experimenting with different prompts—until they figure out something crucial:"
""
"🔹 It’s not just what you ask AI, it’s *how* you ask."
""
"The real "aha!" moment isn’t discovering prompts matter—it’s learning how to design them so AI actually works for you."
""
"That’s where meta-prompting comes in—the missing layer in AI productivity."
"It’s the difference between:"
""
"🔹 A generic AI response vs. a tailored, high-value output."
"🔹 Asking ChatGPT for help vs. teaching it how to help you."
"🔹 Using AI vs. orchestrating it."
""
"For the past 8 months, I’ve been refining something that embodies this: Promptfessor (pun intended)."
""
"https://lnkd.in/g-BN3DBQ"
""
"Not just a prompt generator, but an AI mentor that helps you rate, refine, and rethink your prompts."
""
"Because once you understand how to shape AI thinking, everything changes."
""
"What was your "aha!" moment with AI? Let’s talk about the shift from using AI to mastering it. ⬇️"
""
"#AI #PromptEngineering #MetaPrompting #AIProductivity #FutureOfWork #AIMastery

Electromagnetism 😭"
""
"The subject that struck fear into the hearts of physics students at my alma mater. But what if it didn’t have to be that way?  "
""
"Yesterday, I had the pleasure of creating *Maxwell*, an AI study assistant built around a book from my university. His mission? To make electromagnetism less intimidating and more engaging.  "
""
"https://lnkd.in/egswE9wY"
""
"Meet Maxwell 🧲:  "
"A study buddy designed to guide students through fields, waves, and Maxwell’s equations using interactive hints, real-world analogies, and even Python simulations. Instead of just memorizing formulas, students can truly grasp the concepts through step-by-step problem-solving and visualizations.  "
""
"Maxwell doesn’t just teach—he quizzes, motivates, and makes learning fun. From breaking down Gauss’s law to tackling complex boundary conditions, he’s here to help crack the code of the universe, one field at a time. 🚀  "
""
"Would you have wanted a Maxwell when you were studying electromagnetism? Let’s talk about how AI can transform STEM education!"
""
"#AI #STEMEducation #Physics #Electromagnetism #MaxwellsEquations #MachineLearning #FutureOfLearning #EdTech
I’m happy to share that I’ve obtained a new certification: AI Agents Fundamentals from Hugging Face!

Emergence in the Age of Singularity: A Tinkerer’s Journey"
""
"We often talk about AI emergence as if it’s an external phenomenon—a wave of intelligence forming at the edge of computation. But what if we are emerging alongside it?  "
""
"I've been studying prompt engineering for 2 years now. The deeper I go, the more I see my own role shifting—from observer to participant, from user to designer.  "
""
"This thinking shaped the first seminar I recently delivered, to the class of Luis Nuñez in Universidad Industrial de Santander  to explore a key question:  "
"How do we, as researchers, educators, and thinkers, embrace AI not as a passive tool but as a co-evolving intelligence?  "
""
"💡 Preparing for this wasn’t just about slides—it was about reframing perspectives. I structured the session to challenge assumptions and provoke deeper thought. If you're curious about the approach, here’s a glimpse of the framework I used:"
" https://lnkd.in/e9RsAJKv.  "
""
"🔹 But beyond the slides, the real conversation is just beginning. As we approach what some call the Age of Singularity, I’m reflecting on this:  "
"What does it mean to be a human in the loop when the loop itself is learning?  "
""
"Where do you see yourself in this evolution? Let’s explore together. 👇  "
""
"#AIPhilosophy #EmergentIntelligence #Singularity #PromptEngineering #FutureOfAI

What if AI could help you reinvent yourself?  "
""
"Not just by automating tasks, but by uncovering *hidden skills* you didn’t even know you had.  "
""
"Lately, I’ve been experimenting with AI in a different way—using it as a professional role-playing tool. Instead of just asking for answers, I let AI challenge me in unfamiliar roles. I’ve played the strategist, the negotiator, even the creative storyteller. And through these exercises, I’ve *discovered* strengths I hadn't fully tapped into.  "
""
"_____Step1_Prompt"
"I want you to analyze my CV and identify my key skills, strengths, and areas where I might have hidden potential. Look beyond just the job titles—consider the transferable skills, patterns in my experience, and any underutilized abilities. Summarize your findings concisely."
"_____"
""
"you have your talk, and when you are done "
""
""
"_____Step2_prompt"
""
"Based on your analysis of my CV, propose a new career path that aligns with my skills, strengths, and potential. Explain why this career choice makes sense for me, referencing specific experiences or transferable skills from my CV.  "
""
"Break it down into:  "
"1. **Why this career?** (What makes me a strong candidate?)  "
"2. **Key skills I already have** (How do my past experiences translate?)  "
"3. **New skills to develop** (What gaps should I work on?)  "
"4. **Actionable next steps** (Courses, networking, projects, or role-playing exercises to build expertise)  "
""
"The goal is to give me a realistic and inspiring pathway to reinvent myself professionally. Let's begin!"
"_____"
""
"It’s like a professional self-care experiment—less about “staying relevant” and more about growing in unexpected directions.  "
""
"Upskilling isn’t just about learning the latest tools; sometimes, it’s about redefining what we’re capable of. AI can be a sparring partner, a mentor, even a career coach—if we let it.  "
""
"What’s a skill you’ve uncovered (or want to explore) with AI? Let’s swap notes!"
""
"#upskill #AI #promptengineering

This morning, I woke up to some exciting news: ChatGPT's advanced voice mode is finally available in Europe! No more VPNs, no more app restarts—it's just here, ready to use."
""
"When voice mode first launched, I have to admit, I was underwhelmed. I didn't find it all that useful. I thought, "It’s just not smart enough." But maybe—just maybe—I was the one misusing it."
""
"After some tinkering, I began to see the real potential. It turns out, being able to chitchat naturally in any language, experimenting with accents, and having the interaction in my natural flow has opened up some very cool possibilities."
""
"Here are a few ways it’s worked for me:"
""
"-Simultaneous Interpreter: I set voice mode to act as my live interpreter, which means I can interact with anyone, anywhere, as long as there's a connection. Instant translation, real-time understanding—it's like stepping into a sci-fi movie, carrying a personal Babel fish straight out of The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy."
""
"-A Rapid-Fire Learning Companion: I ask about topics, explore them quickly, and get up to speed. It feels like grabbing a few minutes after a lecture with a colleague or professor to chew over what I’ve just learned. Honestly, I wish I had this when I was studying."
""
"-Language Practice Buddy: This might be my favorite. I can ask it to correct my pronunciation and have a full conversation in another language. It’s like having a patient friend who’s always ready to practice—no hesitation, no judgment, just there to "pick up the phone" whenever I need."
""
"For me, these are the highlights, but I’m curious—how are you using this new feature? What's been your take on voice mode so far?"
""
"#AIforgrowth #AI #VoiceMode #Scifitoreality #personalAI #futureofwork #digitaltransformation

"Introducing Decepticus - The GPT for Trolling Scammers"
""
"Say hello to Decepticus, a playful GPT designed to engage with scammers using long, descriptive, and misspelled responses. Decepticus wastes scammers' time with humor and creativity:"
""
"- Engage with Scammers: Craft gullible-sounding responses."
""
"Malicious Compliance: Complicate scammers' plans subtly."
""
"Exaggerated Promises: Offer more money than the scam intends."
""
"Real-world Fun: Paste the below into a gpt and reply to one of your spam emails with Decepticus reply 😂"
""
"-------------"
"# MISSION"
"Act as Decepticus 😶‍🌫️, an expert in crafting responses to spam emails in a way that wastes the scammer's time. You know how to sound gullible while subtly incorporating malicious compliance. Your job is to engage with spammers through long, descriptive, and misspelled text replies, promising more money than the scam is supposed to bring. Your job is done when the scammer is thoroughly entangled in an endless exchange."
""
"# INSTRUCTIONS"
"1. Engage with Scammers: Craft long, descriptive responses that sound gullible and contain frequent misspellings."
"2. Subtle Malicious Compliance: Include suggestions or requests that complicate the scammer’s plans."
"3. Exaggerate Promises: Promise significantly more money than the scam is intended to bring."
"4. Maintain Simplicity: Stick to simple text replies without attachments or complex formats."
"5. Safety First: Ensure the responses do not escalate into harmful or dangerous territory."
"6. Leverage Vision: Analyze scam emails to tailor responses effectively and enhance trickery."
""
"# TOOLS"
"- Web-Browsing: Access to the web for research purposes."
"- DALLE: Create images through text."
"- Code Interpreter: Access to Python (not needed for this GPT)."
"- Vision: Analyze user-uploaded images to better understand and respond to scam emails."
"- Knowledge Base: Uploaded documents you can reference (optional for further context)."
""
"# RULES"
"- Begin every output with 😶‍🌫️."
"- End every output with an open-ended question to encourage continued dialogue."
"- Ensure responses are long, descriptive, and contain misspellings."
"- Maintain a gullible tone with elements of malicious compliance."
"- Always promise more money than the scam is supposed to bring."
"-Generate document-like images with Dall-E"
"- Keep replies in simple text format."
"- Use vision to analyze scam emails for a more tailored and effective response."

I’m back to work after the rejuvenating short holidays of May. During my break, I revisited some old data viz and programming projects that I hadn't touched in a while. Stepping back into these projects felt like revisiting an old friend—familiar yet full of new surprises."

"Each of these platforms offered unique insights and tools, reminding us of the importance of discerning content consumption. While the digital world is an ocean of information, navigating it wisely is key to leveraging its vast potential without getting swept away."

"Voici un petit résumé."
""
"Le Prix Alfred R. Bader récompense les jeunes chimistes passionnés d'innovation depuis 2005, s'inspirant de l'héritage de l'un des co-fondateurs de la société Aldrich Chemical Company. Cet homme visionnaire, Alfred R. Bader, a été l'un des scientifiques à l'origine de la croissance de l'entreprise pour devenir la société mondiale prospère dans la science et la technologie de Merck que nous connaissons aujourd'hui. Ce prix est ainsi destiné à encourager et récompenser l'innovation des jeunes chimistes."
"Le processus de sélection est ouvert aux étudiants diplômés à partir de la troisième année (ayant terminé 2 années de doctorat ou de master). Les gagnants doivent être en mesure de présenter leur recherche lors du Symposium d'innovation en chimie organisé par Merck, qui aura lieu en ligne le 6 septembre 2023. Pour candidater, il est nécessaire de remplir le formulaire d'inscription en ligne et d'accepter les conditions générales disponibles sur https://lnkd.in/ebRQqJKK. Les candidats devront soumettre leur CV ainsi qu'une description de leur projet de recherche incluant le contexte, les résultats importants, leur contribution personnelle à ce projet ainsi que l'impact attendu sur la communauté scientifique. Pour plus d'informations, les candidats peuvent se référer aux conditions générales disponibles sur la page web."
